case_title: Kh. GHULAM QADIR vs AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondent: AZAD GOVERNMENT OF THE STATE OF JAMMU AND KASHMIR

legal_basis.act: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunals Act, 1975

appellant: Entitled to pay in B.P.S. 20 based on parity with Supreme Court of Pakistan.
Promotion as District and Sessions Judge was unconditional.
Ex-cadre appointment should entitle pay in B.P.S. 20 regardless of promotion.
respondent: Parity cannot be accepted without government order.
Appellant was not confirmed District and Sessions Judge at the time of appointment.
Post was upgraded after appellant's transfer.

tribunal_findings.confirmed_status: Appellant was not a confirmed District and Sessions Judge during the relevant period.
tribunal_findings.pay_scale: Entitlement to pay in B.P.S. 20 requires government-sanctioned order.
tribunal_findings.probation: Confirmation requires a probation period of 2 years under applicable rules.

precedents.case: Province of Punjab v. Ramzan Ali
precedents.principle: Service Tribunal can correct arbitrary or discriminatory decisions.
High Court can direct government to grant specific pay scales.

decision.summary: Appeal dismissed due to lack of entitlement to B.P.S. 20 based on rules and conditions.
decision.costs: Each party to bear its own costs.
